text.p: Integrated Healthcare Inc's talks with two information technology and service companies are "progressing smoothly" and may lead to a merger or sale agreement in January, IHS Chairman Michael Black said.
No further details were available. Company officials were not immediately available to comment.
"If the best option is to sell the company or merge it with another firm, that is what we will do," said Black in a press release.
The unnamed companies have financial and operational resources greater than IHS, IHS said. The talks have centered on IHS's proprietary DataQual information system, IHS added.
IHS also said it is now in the process of retaining an investment banking company to evaluate and structure the proposals. IHS did not name the investment bank.
It said it had not yet decided whether it will hold a shareholders' meeting to approve any transaction.
